data.title: The Towering Inferno - Movie Reviews
data.meta_description: Rotten Tomatoes, home of the Tomatometer, is the most trusted measurement of quality for Movies & TV. The definitive site for Reviews, Trailers, Showtimes, and Tickets
data.text:
The special effects are super and once you get used to the idea of a 136-story building in downtown San Francisco, you are ready for anything thrown at you.

Full Review | Jun 27, 2023

Nearly 50 years after its release, The Towering Inferno remains one of the golden standards in the disaster thriller genre.

Full Review | Original Score: 5/5 | Mar 2, 2023

This is a loud, bombastic, dumb blockbuster and it just doesnâ€™t thrill audiences in the same way that it would have in 1974. I really question whether it became a sensation purely as a result of hype.

Full Review | Original Score: D | Feb 7, 2023

Rather than being a reflection of the true terror of a fire, this is a romp of a disaster movie, with some big, fun set pieces, heroes to root for, and villains to boo.

Full Review | Original Score: 3/5 | Jun 23, 2021

The use of real stunts and real fires lend to a staggering visual design with stellar cinematography to match.

Full Review | Original Score: 8/10 | Aug 31, 2020

An absolutely spectacular cast, and a top-notch technical team, are the pillars on which 'The Towering Inferno' is based, a film built with the precision of an architect. [Full Review in Spanish]

Full Review | Sep 4, 2019

Despite the best efforts of most of those involved, the film never takes off as more than just a remarkable collection of glossy violence.

Full Review | Original Score: 6/10 | Sep 11, 2014

The movie doesn't stick together in one's head; this thing is like some junky fairground show -- a chamber of horrors with skeletons that jump up.

Full Review | Jan 15, 2013

The result is everything a disaster movie should be, a combination of soap opera and the spectacle of destruction.

Full Review | Original Score: 3/4 | Feb 3, 2012

Ironically, there's now something almost comforting about the way the film sticks to formula, but the action is still authentically thrilling.

Full Review | Feb 3, 2012

Irwin Allen, the Busby Berkeley of natural disasters and other people's troubles, teams up with John Guillermin, a competent if undistinguished action director.

Full Review | Feb 3, 2012

A Titanic tale of hubris...knot-in-the-stomach scary from the moment the fire gets out of control to the last-ditch heroics that come hours later. [Blu-ray]

Full Review | Original Score: 3/4 | Jul 28, 2009

break out the popcorn, sit back, and enjoy a galaxy of stars picking up their fat paychecks and having a great time. They absolutely don't make 'em like this anymore

Full Review | Original Score: 3.5/5 | May 13, 2009
